Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, interior spotted with traces of a resinous substance, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and remains of three lines of thinly Coptic text written in black ink, text worn. Text contains Jn 2:1.
Curator's comments: The writer has first made an unsuccessful attempt at the text and then repeated it, rather less inaccurately. He was obviously more at home in Coptic than in Greek.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.31)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (61675) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/61675)
